meta.name: theme-color
meta.title: Board of Elections | Brunswick County, NC

meta.name: description
meta.content: The Board of Elections conducts all federal, state, county, municipal, and special elections in accordance with federal and state law and State Board of Elections policy.

link.script: setEditorVariables(false, 840); function getPrintPreviewType() { return 0; } function printPreview() {pPreview(getPrintPreviewType()); }

div.class: inner col col24 first last id47f17d8c-771e-499c-955c-56e7b5debe11

li.h1: Board of Elections Latest News & Events

li.div: Sample ballots for the upcoming election are now available. Read on...

h4.a: Notice to Voters: Polling Place Relocations for Upcoming Election

li.div: The Brunswick County Board of Elections has voted to relocate five election day polling places for the upcoming general election. Read on...

h4.a: Online Judicial Voter Guide Now Available for 2024 General Election

li.div: The online Judicial Voter Guide is now available on the State Board of Electionsâ€™ website. Read on...

h4.a: Early Voting Schedule Finalized for Presidential Election

li.div: The early voting schedule for the upcoming presidential election has been finalized! Voters will have the convenience of choosing from six designated locations over a period of 17 days. Read on...

div.p: There are no published events in current month.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id6513a8f5-de7a-4e2a-b5a6-6aa33d927840
inner col col2 first last id20b029db-55b2-49fa-ae03-51d48daa2496
inner col col9 first last ida5e75e3d-1af3-42e4-b544-91465bf520d1

li.h2: Help Us Find Suitable Polling Places
li.p: As our county continues to grow, we are in urgent need of additional polling places to ensure every citizen can easily exercise their right to vote. We are reaching out to the community for assistance in identifying suitable locations that meet our specific requirements.

div.class: inner col col2 first last idfa09724f-c2b8-4131-8aa9-f9b5b475a547
inner col col9 first last idc035a928-3c88-4c80-a77b-006fff96c551

li.p: Voters will now be asked to present a valid photo identification when voting in person. If you do not have a valid photo ID card, you may obtain one from your county board of elections prior to the election, through the end of the early voting period.
